intro: Topobea discolor, commonly known as the pale-leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its disc-shaped flower heads and pale green to white petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine, powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss. Topobea discolor is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
